sense.name: Throw or hit carelessly.
sense.examples: He chucked the ball in the air and walked off the field. She chucked a book at the student before slapping him silly. He chucked the puck down center ice.

sense.name: Discard.
sense.commentary: Includes: CHUCK AWAY, CHUCK OUT Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CHUCK NP2[patient]
sense.examples: She chucked that copy of her thesis and began to revise. Chuck out your worries; it's time to party! Don't just chuck your life in a back corner - live it. Let's just chuck the nonconforming data. Last summer he chucked his 10-year career as a London stockbroker and headed for the mountains.

sense.name: Expel, as from a competition, activity, or location.
sense.commentary: Includes: CHUCK OUT Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CHUCK OUT NP2[patient[animate]]
sense.examples: The unruly player was chucked out of the game. We chucked Lizzie out of our dance party. She was so lame! The bouncers chucked him out the front door.

sense.name: Pat or squeeze, especially under the chin.
sense.examples: Chuck under chin three times and apply salt.

sense.name: Vomit.
sense.commentary: Note: NOT 'upchuck' - that's a different verb. Includes: CHUCK UP
sense.examples: He chucked all over the lawn. Why even offer it - he's just gonna chuck it all up!

sense.name: CHUCK UP THE SPONGE: give up in the face of defeat, as in boxing.
sense.examples: In the second round, the challenger chucked up the sponge.

sense.name: Put forward for consideration.
sense.examples: He chucked a few ideas out there and let the board decide. I just wanted to chuck that out there for ya.

sense.name: CHUCK UP TO: Put forward for consideration.
sense.examples: I chuck it up to bad manners and lack of discipline. She chucked her performance up to nerves.
